    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PolygonZ(byte[] rawData)

      This is the constructor that does not include the optional measure data.
      PolygonZ(int[] parts, double[][] points, double[] zArray, double[] mArray)
      This is the constructor that does include the optional measure data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PolygonZ

        public PolygonZ(byte[] rawData)
        This constructor is used when the PolygonZ is being created from data that is read directly from a file.
        Parameters:
        rawData - A byte array containing all of the raw data needed to create the PolygonZ, starting with the bounding box, i.e. leaving out the ShapeType data.

      • PolygonZ

        public PolygonZ(int[] parts,
                double[][] points,
                double[] zArray)
        This is the constructor that does not include the optional measure data.
        Parameters:
        parts - an int array that indicates the zero-base starting byte for each part.
        points - a double[][] array containing the point data. The first dimension of the array is the total number of points in the polygon.
        zArray - a double[] array containing the z data for each point.

      • PolygonZ

        public PolygonZ(int[] parts,
                double[][] points,
                double[] zArray,
                double[] mArray)
        This is the constructor that does include the optional measure data.
        Parameters:
        parts - an int array that indicates the zero-base starting byte for each part.
        points - a double[][] array containing the point data. The first dimension of the array is the total number of points in the polygon.
        zArray - a double[] array containing the z data for each point.
        mArray - a double[] array containing the measure data for each point.
